task_description: Facing the building to your South-West (approx. 220°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full vertical extent of the main building ahead, so I should tilt up to capture the roofline for height estimation.
I’m no longer facing the target SW building, so I should rotate back to ~221° while keeping an upward pitch to capture its roofline for height estimation.
I need the building’s top and base in view to estimate total height, so I’ll look up first to capture the roofline and upper floors.
The view has snapped back to 0° again, so I must rotate to ~220° SW (keeping pitch up) to re-acquire the target building’s roofline.
To estimate height I need to see the top of the building clearly, so I will tilt the camera upward while staying aimed at 220°.
I need to face the SW building again to estimate its height, so I’ll rotate from 0° to about 220° while keeping the upward pitch.
Repeated rotations are not holding pitch, so I should keep the current correct heading and move closer to the building to better judge its number of stories and overall height.
I’m now facing SE, so I should rotate right to ~234° which is close to the required ~220° to bring the target building back into view.
I need to face about 220° (SW), so from 90° I should rotate right by roughly 130° to align with the target building.
The target direction is explicitly available to the right at heading 220°, so I should rotate right to align with the SW-facing building.
My rotations have been inconsistent, so I'll use an absolute custom rotation to face 220° SW directly from 90°.
From 130° I can directly turn right to 220° (SW) to face the target building, so I'll rotate +90°.
I’m stuck oscillating between 90° and 130°, so I should rotate right to 180° first (a stable reference) before turning further to 220°.

Rotations aren’t changing the heading as expected, so I will stop trying to reposition and provide a reasonable height estimate based on a typical mid-rise main building of about 4 stories (~3.5 m per story).
